metadata.title: CVE-2023-4155 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in KVM AMD Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) in theLinux kernel. A KVM guest using SEV-ES or SEV-SNP with multiple vCPUs cantrigger a double fetch race condition vulnerability and invoke the`VMGEXIT` handler recursively. If an attacker manages to call the handlermultiple times, they can trigger a stack overflow and cause a denial ofservice or potentially guest-to-host escape in kernel configurationswithout stack guard pages (`CONFIG_VMAP_STACK`).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-ibm - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required
